title: How to File for a California Domestic Partnership

steps.title: Determine whether you and your partner meet the basic requirements to qualify for domestic-partnership status.
steps.content: Determine whether you and your partner meet the basic requirements to qualify for domestic-partnership status. Certain conditions must be met before a couple can formally apply for California domestic partnership with the Secretary of State' office. Requirements include: [1] X Research source Partners must be the same gender, or at least 1 person in an opposite-gender domestic partnership must be at least 62 years old at the time of filing. [2] X Research source If you have romantic feelings for a friend of the same gender but are unsure about their sexuality, you can have general discussions about sexuality and desire. [3] X Research source It will make them aware that you are interested in same-gender relationships. You can also get an idea of their interests. Even after such conversations, if you do not get to know whether they are attracted to you, be honest and let them know about your interest. Both people must be at least 18 years old. The partners must have a common residence. The primary residence doesn't have to be jointly owned. One or both have own other homes, however. Neither partner may be married to or in a concurrent domestic partnership with another person. Partners cannot be related by blood. Both people must be mentally capable of consenting to the partnership.

steps.title: Complete the application process as set forth by the California Secretary of State's office.
steps.content: Complete the application process as set forth by the California Secretary of State's office.

steps.title: Download the Declaration of Domestic Partnership form (NP/SF DP-1) from the secretary of state's website at www.sos.ca.gov.
steps.content: Download the Declaration of Domestic Partnership form (NP/SF DP-1) from the secretary of state's website at www.sos.ca.gov. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Print and fill out the application.
steps.content: Print and fill out the application. Incomplete forms will delay approval of your status.

steps.title: Send the notarized application to the secretary of state's office by mail with payment for the appropriate fee.
steps.content: Send the notarized application to the secretary of state's office by mail with payment for the appropriate fee. Applications also can be delivered in person at the main office in Sacramento or the regional branch in Los Angeles. [5] X Trustworthy Source State of California Official website for the State of California Go to source After you have filed your application, you will receive a Certificate of Registration of Domestic Partnership and an important brochure that outlines your rights with a domestic partnership.
